means: 百科全书般的，学识渊博的

sentence.Network_en: She has an encyclopedic knowledge of natural history.
sentence.Network_cn: 她具有广博的自然史知识。

sentence.Network_en: In this sense, the encyclopedic cultural value and historic significance of Dunhuang are inestimable.
sentence.Network_cn: 从这个意义上来说, 敦煌百科全书般的文化价值和历史重量是无法估计的.

sentence.Network_en: He had an encyclopedic command of the field of knowledge, and by a word or a phase, by delicate rapier thrust, he punctured them.
sentence.Network_cn: 他所掌握的知识就像百科全书那样丰富.用一个字或一句话, 用几句灵敏机智的对答, 他就洞穿了对方的要害.

entry.tran: 百科全书般的;知识丰富的
entry.def: If you describe something as encyclopedic, you mean that it is very full, complete, and thorough in the amount of knowledge or information that it has.

example.ex: He had an encyclopaedic knowledge of drugs.
example.tran: 他在药品方面学识广博。

auth_sentence.content: His intellectual apprehension was...heightened, and his knowledge...became encyclopedic.
